intro: Eriocoma arnowiae, commonly known as the hairy eriocoma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage that provides insulation and protection against harsh environmental conditions. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. Eriocoma arnowiae is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
